Body: Unlike most apps, the Android browser doesn't seem to exit when you hit the Back key to exit to the home screen.  This happens even when I have no web pages open.  There doesn't seem to be an Exit option when I press the Menu button in the browser, either.For whatever reason, Android rarely kills it like it does with other apps. It takes up quite a bit of memory and even CPU time when in the background. Either way, all my other apps exit nicely and I'd prefer that the browser did too.Is there any way I can get the browser to exit?  One could use a task killer but it's a bit of a hassle and it seems to leak memory when I kill it with TouchWiz's built-in task manager, besides the fact that task killers suck.I have a Galaxy S Vibrant running Android 2.2 with TouchWiz.
Title: How can I get the stock browser to exit?

history.Text: Unlike most apps, the Android browser doesn't seem to exit when you hit the Back key to exit to the home screen.  This happens even when I have no web pages open.  There doesn't seem to be an Exit option when I press the Menu button in the browser, either.Is there any way I can get the browser to exit?  I can use a task killer but it's a bit of a hassle and it seems to leak memory when I just kill it.I have a Galaxy S Vibrant running Android 2.2.
